meanings.sent1: The infracting behavior led to a warning from the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The student's infracting actions resulted in detention.
meanings.sent3: It was quite silly how the infracting squirrel kept stealing nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her infracting tendencies were like a red flag waving in front of authority figures.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of infracting were made crystal clear during the school assembly.

meanings.sent1: He risked infracting the terms of the agreement by not delivering on time.
meanings.sent2: The company sued for damages after the contractor was infracting the contract.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be infracting the deal they made about not jumping on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: Infracting the contract felt like tearing apart a promise made in ink.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of infracting a contract can be severe in the business world.

meanings.sent1: The kids were infracting the curfew set by their parents.
meanings.sent2: Infracting the speed limit can result in a traffic ticket.
meanings.sent3: The puppy kept infracting the imaginary line drawn to keep it out of the garden.
meanings.sent4: Infracting the boundary felt like stepping over an invisible electric fence.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of infracting a limit can lead to unforeseen outcomes.
